description: The coffee is the smoothest I've ever had. Deep, dark and delicious. Perfectly roasted. Lattes are also fabulous. It's great when someone plays the piano or guitar. Wifi is always up and ready. Great panino. Longer hours would make for 5 stars
author: Brian F.

description: I find it quite hilarious how poorly disguised Cafe Trieste is as the Roastery. Their coffee is pretty good, although it suffers from the San Francisco trend of tasting slightly burnt, and it's slightly expensive. It's fun to sit outside here and people watch; Academy of Art is across the street and full of interesting art students.
author: Daniel C.

description: I used to frequent the Roastery every morning for coffee and a bagel when I was getting my masters at Academy of Art. Today I was craving a bagel with jam so I walked an extra four blocks to my old stomping grounds. I waited in line for 10 minutes (no one was in front of me, the baristas just pretended I wasn't there). I ordered my plain bagel toasted with cream cheese and jam and waited another 10 minutes for it to arrive at the counter. When my order was called, they got it wrong, making the bagel on wheat instead of plain. I kindly told the barista that I ordered plain and he argued saying I did not and that I should double check my order in the future. Not my job. Needless to say I'm very disappointed and won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Gigi R.

description: Coffee is good, strong and dark, the food is alright, definitely better than in most coffee shops. However, the atmosphere and the people make the place great. I have spent hours in here waiting for friends to get out of class at AAU and watched many owners come and go and yet to my delight they have all seemed to keep the big piano, great music, and friendly baristas. Free wifi is amazing always fast and their comfy furniture makes it easy to spend hours there. One of the best places to pass the time.
author: Carolyn N.

description: i actually really like this place. The employees are always nice, and they have a good selection. I'll often get their veggie bagel before work. But it can be kind of annoying that they have a $3 min on credit cards.
author: Tim R.

description: they make a proper americano and espresso never tastes burnt. starbucks version tastes more like hot water than anything. pesto chicken panini is super yummy, bagels come with half a block of cream cheese which is otay with me :)   many of the reviews give it a bad rating for poor service , i cant say that has EVER happenned to me.   $3 min. for plastic.
author: Wei W.

description: Come here more and more, enjoyed the music they play most of time, love their free AT&T wifi 99% of time, which is fast and stayed-able. But I still don't like their coffee that much. Too roasted and over burnt, for me. Today, I ordered Espresso, surprisingly good! 4 stars for the Espresso with music, sunshine came through the window, and successful meeting worth to sit there for about 3 hours. The Espresso was smooth and works on me like a sec! Haha... don't make me wrong. It must be having normal amount of caffeine, well, maybe a bit more than normal in there for a regular coffee drinker, but for sure strong enough for the person like me maybe drink coffee twice a week, was super tired seconds ago. Anyway, at the same time when I asked for Espresso, since they have a $3 dollar min order required, I ordered a croissant with my ATM card. But when the bill came out, the Batista only charged for Espresso. I asked, "does it include croissant?" Maybe he forgot or maybe he's just being nice. "Don't worry about it." He said. THANK YOU.
author: Flora F.

description: My first mistake was ordering a sandwich at a coffe shop, but I was in a hurry. So I order a panini, mayo only.  Although its well after the lunch rush, it takes the rasta gentleman working the sandwich area a full five minutes to even start on my order.  So ten minutes later, I get my sandwich and head back to the office to eat.  I get all the way back, open up the bag and not only is there no mayo, the thing is drowned in mustard.  I return for a refund, receipt in hand with the words "MAYO ONLY" clearly printed on it in large type.  The pretty goth with face piercings  working the cash register shoots me a glare and asks if I want something else.  Well, no I don't have another ten minutes to wait for a sandwich as my lunch break is over.  She rolls her eyes, and hands me my money.  I stand there for a moment, waiting for her to say something.  When nothing comes, I ask, "So I guess I'm not getting an apology?  She stares blankly at me so I leave, never to return.  Having read some of the other reviews, I have to ask, Who hires these rude people? In these rough economic times, couldn't the owners find people who are actually thankful to have a job?!?
author: Tony C.

description: My carmel frappe was merely ice blended milk with the very slightest hint of caramel. I didn't notice any coffee in it at all. And after I drank all of the milk out of the beverage, most of the cup still retained blended ice, so it was really just like drinking plain old milk. As far as their other items on the menu are concerned, I'm sure they are far superior, I was just disappointed to spend so much money on a milk snow cone that I could have made at home. So judging on this one single experience, it gets one star. Aside from that, nice people seem to work there as far as I could tell. The food looks delicious, and if I had more money I would go back and try that.
author: Dave N.

description: this place serves the best coffee ever. it's reliably strong (not weak or watery like most places). oh and it tastes awesome. the staff has always been friendly to me. they have an extensive menu that covers all kinds of breakfast and lunch items. they're the perfect cafe. thanks!
author: sarah p.
